entities.description: Classification of methamphetamine use disorder based on the number of criteria met.
Consumption of methamphetamine, either intended or repeated use.
Increased chances of getting physically hurt due to methamphetamine use.
Problems or arguments with family caused or worsened by the use of substances.
Impact on work, school, or home due to substance use, such as job loss or poor academic performance.
Problems with emotions, mental health, or physical health due to substance use.
Effects or issues caused by the use of methamphetamine, such as feeling effects or needing more to feel the desired effects.

relationships.description: Determines the classification of methamphetamine use disorder based on criteria met by the respondent.
Indicates that the respondent is consuming or has consumed methamphetamine.
Using methamphetamine increases the likelihood of physical harm.
Continued use of methamphetamine worsens family-related problems.
Methamphetamine use affects work, school, or home responsibilities.
Methamphetamine use causes issues with emotions and mental health.
Respondent experiences effects or issues related to methamphetamine use.
